page.title: 20Life at Castle Water.
page.content: Castle Water is a wildlife conservation estate, part of the Rye Harbour{S.S.S.I. (Site of Special {Scientific Interest).}At the man made gravel pits aquatic plants and insects, fish, ducks, and swans live in harmony with dinghy sailors, bird-watchers, botanists and light aircraft fliers. There is also a{spinning centre}on the Estate making use of the fleece from nearby{Romney Marsh sheep.}The art of spinning on a wheel is demonstrated at local craft markets. Castle Water Estate now has{250 {members}& fulfils its declared objective of giving animals and people the chance to get to know one another better. { * The children and staff of Freda {Gardham School, Rye compiled this part {of the Domesday Project, July 1985.
